judges: Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Finletter.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: F. Gilman Spencer, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him E. Russell Shochley, Deputy Attorney General, and Olaude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant.
William H. S. Wells, Avith him Saul, Etoing, Remich & Harrison, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Girard Trust Company’s Case.
Argued November 26, 1941.
Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
F. Gilman Spencer, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him E. Russell Shochley, Deputy Attorney General, and Olaude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant.
William H. S. Wells, Avith him Saul, Etoing, Remich & Harrison, for appellee.
January 5, 1942:
